description.narrative: 20 interfaith women’s groups (400 women) have access to finance and participate in household and community decision making processes including the prevention/reporting of GBV in 20 communities in Pujehun district. •At least 10000 congregation members and others from other institutions are aware of gender issues including gender-based violence and how to prevent/report it. •100 religious leaders engaged to include in their sermons gender equity issues, religious tolerance and GBV prevention messages. •At least 10000 Muslims/Christians understand GBV related issues and how to prevent it •At least 10000 chiefs/traditional leaders including youth understand the popularization of “Chid Protection” document. •At least 10000 Muslims/Christians trained and understand the concepts of SRHR issues including gender •10000 youth are sensitized on gender based violence through radio discussion programmes.

Establish 20 interfaith women’s groups in 20 communities in 8 chiefdoms in Pujehun district. •Train 20 women’s groups (400 women) in savings group methodology and GBV prevention/reporting •Facilitate income generation and savings scheme for 20 women’s groups (400 women). •Hold consultative and planning meetings with 100 religious leaders – on Gender Equality and GBV prevention and to integrate these messages in sermons – including understanding he Gender Justice Framework. •Support the production of jingles/songs and performance sessions in schools and institutions on Gender Equality and GBV prevention. •Training on interfaith and women leaders on Gender Justice Network •Hold interactive forum for male and female pastors and imams in Pujehun •Radio Talk shows on Gender Equality and GBV Prevention from an inter-faith perspective •Popularization of “Child Protection” document •Training of interfaith leaders on SRHR issues •Monitoring of activities
